recipes.title: Italian Broccoli-Bacon Pasta

winePairing.pairingText: Italian on the menu? Try pairing with Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. One wine you could try is Castello di Volpaia Chianti Classico Riserva. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 24 dollars.

productMatches.title: Castello di Volpaia Chianti Classico Riserva
productMatches.description: Color: Ruby red with a trace of garnet Nose: Elegant and intense with hints of spices connected with fruity scents Taste: Good structure with evident tannins and long persistence

recipes.instructions: Cook the small broccoli florets in boiling water with 1 tsp salt until soft (they should be bright green). Drain and set aside.Cook the pasta in boiling water with 1 tsp salt until al dente (follow instructions on the package). Drain and put back in the pot. Melt 2 Tbsp butter and mix into the pasta.In a large skillet, heat the olive oil on medium-high, add the bacon and fry until lightly crisp. Fold a paper towel and put it in the skillet. Move it around the pan with spatula until it soaks up most of the fat. Discard the paper towel.Reduce to medium heat. Add the garlic and fry for 2 to 3 minutes stirring constantly.Add the broccoli and season with salt and pepper. Stir over medium heat for 2 minutes.Add the broccoli mixture to the pasta. Mix well and serve with Parmesan.
